page.title: 03THE ALMSHOUSES
page.content: In our village behind the church there are seventeen houses - almshouses- which were built in 1681. They are grey stone terraced houses with fancy gables and tiny gardens with rockeries and gravel paths and a few wooden benches. They have diamond patterned windows and everthing looks well cared for. The keys to the front doors are large - about 2O cms.- old fashioned and highly decorated. They belong to the Port Charity but originally Sir John Port left some money for them to be built. Old people used to live in them but at the moment, they are being modernised. The people should be able to move back next year.
